bioghist.p: Dr. Wilbur H. Oda (1892â€“1953), was a collector of German-Americana and a colleague of Alfred L. Shoemaker. He was head of the Department of Modern Languages at Germantown Academy, and later joined the staff of the Perkiomen School at Pennsburg. While at the Germantown Academy he also served as president of the Germantown Historical Society. In 1989, a bibliography of monographs and almanacs printed in the German language between 1728 and 1830 was published based on Oda's studies and those of the 19th century scholar Oswald Seidensticker.

scopecontent.p: This is a miscellaneous collection of clippings, fragments of printed works, newsletters, letters and other documents. Of note are a series of humorous advertisements for cough syrup, editorial cartoons from 1936, and numerous title pages from German bibles printed in the United States. The collection also includes some biographical information about German Americans involved in the early period of the country's book trade.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
